page.title: 19Transport in Rubery
page.content: Most homes in Rubery have a car. In a school survey 71% of pupils parents have a car which they use regularly. This is not surprising since a lot of the parents of the children at this school in fact work at the nearby Austin Rover Plant building the Metro car. Cars then are the predominant form of private transport, hence the village of Rubery being bounded on the one side by the M5 Motorway, and indeed a dual carriageway going straight through the middle of the village. There is no direct railway station which serves Rubery village, the nearest being at Bromsgrove or at Longbridge. The area is however well served by regular bus services which go to nearby Bromsgrove and Birmingham.
